item.title: Leetcode SQL Interview Answer
item.description: 178 Rank Scores Level: Medium SELECT Score, DENSE_RANK() OVER(ORDER BY Score DESC) ‘Rank’ FROM Scores Please know the difference between DENSE_RANK() and RANK() 177 Nth Highest Salary Level: Medium CREATE FUNCTION getNthHighestSalary(N INT) RETURNS INT BEGIN RETURN ( SELECT DISTINCT a.Salary FROM (SELECT Salary, DENSE_RANK() OVER(ORDER BY Salary DESC) rnk FROM Employee) a WHERE a.rnk = n ); END

item.title: Leetcode SQL Interview Question
item.description: RANK() & Window Function 178 Rank Scores Level: Medium Write a SQL query to rank scores. If there is a tie between two scores, both should have the same ranking. Note that after a tie, the next ranking number should be the next consecutive integer value. In other words, there should be no “holes” between ranks. +—-+——-+ | Id | Score | +—-+——-+ | 1 | 3.

item.title: Define Yourself
item.description: Tell Me a Bit About Yourself This is an opportunity to connect your experience with the job you’ re interviewing for This is not a time to just read off your resume or blab about your personal life Pick out a few of the key things you ‘d like your interviewer to know about you. Example Answer Interviewer: Tell me a bit about yourself

item.title: Launching Questions in Product Case
item.description: Launching Question Launching products is one of the most important duties of a PM, so it makes sense that interviewers would ask how you would do this. Approach The Product: Discuss the vision of the product, along with its strengths, weaknesses, and risks. What does the product ultimately hope to achieve? What is its target market? What are the things that would worry you? Who is it competing against and how is it positioned against those?

item.title: Marketing Questions in Product Case
item.description: Marketing questions are about product positioning, customers, and handling competition. Approach: Understand the Company: What are the company’s goals? What is its mission? What are its strengths and weaknesses? What threatens it? Understand the Competition: Break down the competition into segments. Who competes and in what market?(竞争对手是谁) How do they position themselves? How entrenched are they?(怎么巩固自己的位置) What are their strengths and weaknesses? Understand the Customers: Who are your customers?

item.title: Strategy Questions in Product Case
item.description: Boston Street | Shot on iPhone X Type of Metrics (Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Referral, and Revenue) User acquisition (用户注册率） How many users do you have ? How and why has user base grown overtime? How many active users are there? How do we define what an active user is ? Where are users coming from? Are they referring their friends? Which channels are the most effective in getting users
